N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 337.35 - Absence-extraordinary circumstances

State Regulations

An employee who has reported for work and, because of
extraordinary circumstances beyond the employee's control, e.g., extreme
weather conditions or physical plant breakdown, is directed by the chief
administrative officer, or designee, to leave work, shall not be required to
charge such directed absence during such day against leave accruals. Any such
release of employees shall not create any right to equivalent time off by
employees who are not directed to leave work. Notes
